ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course taught me a new lense through which to approach the history of art. Instead of thinking about isolated works of art or artists I learned to think about the ways in which objects are contextualized and how they are employed to do different types of cultural work.

You will learn a lot about the history of the formation of collections, and generally collecting, institutionally. This class exposes students to not only western institutions but also looks to non-western sources. I learned a lot about the background to specific museums and the motivations of many of the collectors who built large collections. Further, this class also considers more up-to-date collecting practices like franchise and global museums.
I learned a great deal about this history of collecting and institutions.
This course was a great exploration of object collecting. Much more than simply how museums collect their works.
I learned about collecting practices from the 18th century to present-day. The course covered everything from private collections, artists as collectors, cultural capital, and museums.

I learned a lot about museum collections and how they are formed. I also loved that we were able to travel to different museums in order to compare the ways that different collections were formed. We even got to take a trip to D.C. where we saw the National Portrait Gallery and the National Museum of African American History and Culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The readings were, at times, a little dense, but overall very interesting. Considering that this was a WR credit, I don't feel that there was much emphasis on, or feedback to, our writing.
The class was open enough that it allowed you do a deep dive into whatever subject interested you.
Great discussion because its a high level art history course.
I thought this was a great course. Professor Rizvi is a great seminar leader, and the syllabus was great.
I think that the course was well run, and professor Rizvi was always prepared. I don't have too many suggestions for improvement.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Take this class - it is wonderful!
Yes, excellent course with an excellent professor.
If you put in the work, you can get a lot out of it.
Yes! This was a really great course. It made me rethink how I see museums as public institutions. The syllabus was really well-designed, and Professor Rizvi did a great job leading class discussion.
